fields.title: WFP Chad Emergency Action in Support of the Government’s Response: External Situation Report #1 - April 2023
fields.body:
**Context**

• Up to 20,000 people (UNHCR estimate) are seeking refuge along Chad’s border, following clashes which broke out in Sudan on the 15th of April 2023 • Chad hosts 600,000 refugees and 381,290 internally displaced persons (IDPs)

• 1.9 million projected to be severely food insecure during the lean season (March 2023, Cadre Harmonisé)

• 1.3 million people affected by floods

**WFP REFUGEE RESPONSE: A RACE TO PREPOSITION FOOD**

• On the 26th of April, WFP began distributing food assistance to the new refugees who have fled the crisis in Sudan (see map on page 4), and as of the 28th of April, WFP has assisted 4,200 people so far. Distributions first started in Koufroun, Midjiguilta and Diza Berte in the East of Chad and WFP has reprioritized 340 MT of food for the Farchana area, which is enough to provide 20,000 people with 1 month’s assistance, in support of the Government of Chad’s response, and more dispatches are being sent.

• Prepositioning of food for 100,000 Sudanese refugees and host communities (UNHCR figure) on a no-regret basis is urgently needed before the start of the rainy season in June. WFP plans to provide 2 months of in-kind food and 4 months of cash-based transfers (CBT).

• The situation in Chad’s border area of Adre is compounded by food scarcity and WFP has observed a 54% rise in the price of sorghum from April 14th – 24th.

# WFP Chad Emergency Action in Support of the Government’s Response: External Situation Report #1 - April 2023

**Context**

• Up to 20,000 people (UNHCR estimate) are seeking refuge along Chad’s border, following clashes which broke out in Sudan on the 15th of April 2023 • Chad hosts 600,000 refugees and 381,290 internally displaced persons (IDPs)

• 1.9 million projected to be severely food insecure during the lean season (March 2023, Cadre Harmonisé)

• 1.3 million people affected by floods

**WFP REFUGEE RESPONSE: A RACE TO PREPOSITION FOOD**

• On the 26th of April, WFP began distributing food assistance to the new refugees who have fled the crisis in Sudan (see map on page 4), and as of the 28th of April, WFP has assisted 4,200 people so far. Distributions first started in Koufroun, Midjiguilta and Diza Berte in the East of Chad and WFP has reprioritized 340 MT of food for the Farchana area, which is enough to provide 20,000 people with 1 month’s assistance, in support of the Government of Chad’s response, and more dispatches are being sent.

• Prepositioning of food for 100,000 Sudanese refugees and host communities (UNHCR figure) on a no-regret basis is urgently needed before the start of the rainy season in June. WFP plans to provide 2 months of in-kind food and 4 months of cash-based transfers (CBT).

• The situation in Chad’s border area of Adre is compounded by food scarcity and WFP has observed a 54% rise in the price of sorghum from April 14th – 24th.
summary: WFP is providing food assistance to refugees who have fled the crisis in Sudan, and has reprioritized 340 MT of food for the Farchana area. Prepositioning of food for 100,000 Sudanese refugees and host communities is urgently needed before the start of the rainy season in June. WFP plans to provide 2 months of in-kind food and 4 months of cash-based transfers. The situation in Chad’s border area of Adre is compounded by food scarcity and WFP has observed a 54% rise in the price of sorghum.
